dublinCore.dc:title: 113 S164 PCS: To prohibit the United States from providing financial assistance to Pakistan until Dr. Shakil Afridi is freed.
dublinCore.dc:rights: Pursuant to Title 17 Section 105 of the United States Code, this file is not subject to copyright protection and is in the public domain.

form.current-chamber: IN THE SENATE OF THE UNITED STATES

action.action-desc: Mr. Paul introduced the following bill; which was read the first time
Read the second time and placed on the calendar

form.official-title: To prohibit the United States from providing financial assistance to Pakistan until Dr. Shakil Afridi is freed.

section.header: Limitation on foreign assistance to Pakistan
section.text: The United States may not obligate or expend any direct financial assistance to the Government of Pakistan unless the President certifies to Congress thatâ€”

paragraph.text: Dr. Shakil Afridi has been released from prison in Pakistan;
any criminal charges brought against Dr. Afridi, including treason, have been dropped; and
Dr. Afridi has been allowed to leave Pakistan, if such departure is necessary to ensure his freedom.

endorsement.action-desc: Read the second time and placed on the calendar
